sen.j: 多田 知実（ただ ともざね、生没年未詳）は、平安時代末期の武士。
sen.e: Tomozane TADA (years of birth and death unknown) is a busho (Japanese military commander) in the last days of Heian period.
Tomozane TADA (year of birth and death unknown) is a busho (Japanese military commander) in the last days of Heian period.
sen.cmt: year用語統一リストより訂正しました。
sen.e: Tomozane TADA (year of birth and death unknown) is a busho (Japanese military commander) in the last days of Heian period.
The real family name is Genji.
The real family name is Genji (Minamoto clan).
The real family name is Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 家系は清和源氏の一家系 摂津源氏の流れを汲む多田源氏の嫡流 多田氏。
sen.e: The Tada clan is a direct descendant of Tada-Genji that was derived from Settsu-Genji, a descent of Seiwa-Genji.
The Tada clan is a direct descendant of Tada-Genji that was derived from Settsu-Genji, a descent of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).
The Tada clan is a direct descendant of Tada-Genji that was derived from Settsu-Genji, a descent of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 正式な名乗りは源知実(みなもとのともざね)とも。
sen.e: It is also believed that his official Nanori (the name one refers to himself as when reaching adulthood) is MINAMOTO no Tomozane.
It is also believed that his official nanori (the name one refers to himself as when reaching adulthood) is MINAMOTO no Tomozane.
sen.cmt: nanori 小文字にしました。
sen.e: It is also believed that his official nanori (the name one refers to himself as when reaching adulthood) is MINAMOTO no Tomozane.

sen.j: 多田源氏の惣領であった源頼盛の次男で、兄に多田行綱(多田蔵人大夫)、弟に能瀬高頼(皇嘉門院蔵人)、高実(高松院蔵人)があった。
sen.e: He is the second son of MINAMOTO no Yorimori who was Soryo (heir) of the Tada-Genji, and he had an older brother called Yukitsuna TADA (Tada kurodo no daibu (Master of Chamberlain)) and younger brothers, Takayori NOSE (Kokamonin Kurodo (the Chamberlain of Shikikenmonin)) and Takazane (高松院蔵人).
sen.cmt: 高松院蔵人、不明のため和文のまま。
sen.e: He is the second son of MINAMOTO no Yorimori who was Soryo (heir) of the Tada-Genji (Minamoto clan), and he had an older brother called Yukitsuna TADA (Tada kurodo no daibu [Master of Chamberlain]) and younger brothers, Takayori NOSE (Kokamonin Kurodo [the Chamberlain of Kokamonin]) and Takazane (Takamatsuin Kurodo [the Chamberlain of Takamatsuin]).
sen.cmt: 括弧内括弧を[]に訂正しました。 (Minamoto clan)補足しました。(Chamberlain)補足しました。ShikikenmoninをKokamoninに訂正しました。高松院蔵人→(Takamatsuin Kurodo [the Chamberlain of Takamatsuin]) に訂正しました。
sen.e: He is the second son of MINAMOTO no Yorimori who was Soryo (heir) of the Tada-Genji (Minamoto clan), and he had an older brother called Yukitsuna TADA (Tada kurodo no daibu [Master of Chamberlain]) and younger brothers, Takayori NOSE (Kokamonin Kurodo [the Chamberlain of Kokamonin]) and Takazane (Takamatsuin Kurodo [the Chamberlain of Takamatsuin]).
Another name is Jiro TADA.
Another name is Jiro TADA.
Another name is Jiro TADA.

sen.j: 『平家物語』巻四にある「源氏揃え」では兄の行綱が鹿ヶ谷の陰謀による密告を批判される一方、摂津国の源氏として弟の高頼や太田頼基らと共に「多田次郎朝実」としてその名が挙げられている。
sen.e: In "Genji soroe" (to arrange the Minamoto family) of "Heike Monogatari" Vol. 4 ("The Tale of the Heike" Vol. 4), he is mentioned as the Minamoto clan from Settsu Province together with his younger brother Takayori and Yorimoto ODA under the name of "Jirotomozane TADA", while his older brother Yukitsuna is criticized for the betrayal during the Shishigatani plot.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 'Genji soroe' (to arrange the Minamoto family) of "Heike Monogatari" (The Tale of the Heike) Vol. 4, he is mentioned as the Minamoto clan from Settsu Province together with his younger brother Takayori and Yorimoto ODA under the name of 'Jirotomozane TADA,' while his older brother Yukitsuna is criticized for the betrayal during the Shishigatani plot.
sen.cmt: 原文に合せて"を'に訂正しました。括弧の位置を訂正し、" " Vol.4 削除しました。コンマの位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: In 'Genji soroe' (to arrange the Minamoto family) of "Heike Monogatari" (The Tale of the Heike) Vol. 4, he is mentioned as the Minamoto clan from Settsu Province together with his younger brother Takayori and Yorimoto ODA under the name of 'Jirotomozane TADA,' while his older brother Yukitsuna is criticized for the betrayal during the Shishigatani plot.

sen.j: しかし、詳しい事跡は全く不明であり早逝した可能性が高い。
sen.e: However, his detailed achievements are totally unknown, and it is highly possible that he died young.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, his detailed achievements are totally unknown, and it is highly possible that he died young.
However, his detailed achievements are totally unknown, and it is highly possible that he died young.

sen.j: 『尊卑分脈』によると判官を務めていたとされる。
sen.e: He is said to have served as Hangan (an inspector (third highest of the four administrative ranks of the ritsuryo period)) according to "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy).

He is said to have served as Hangan (an inspector [third highest of the four administrative ranks of the ritsuryo period]) according to "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy).
sen.cmt: 括弧内括弧を[]に訂正しました。
sen.e: He is said to have served as Hangan (an inspector [third highest of the four administrative ranks of the ritsuryo period]) according to "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy).
